subject: Languages
title: Language Death: How Languages Disappear
description: Learn Language Death: How Languages Disappear in one minute.

hook.text: A language dies every two weeks. By 2100, half of today's 7,000 languages may be gone.

buildup.text: Languages die when children stop learning them â€” switching to a dominant language for economic opportunity.

discovery.text: Language death usually takes three generations: bilingual grandparents, semi-speakers, monolingual grandchildren.

twist.text: Languages aren't killed by other languages directly. They die from inequality, stigma, and policy.

climax.text: When a language dies, unique knowledge about plants, animals, and ecosystems often vanishes with it.

punchline.text: Every dead language takes answers to questions we haven't thought to ask yet.

quiz.question: How does language death typically happen?
options: Children shift to a dominant language over three generations
